section.title: Description
section.p: The public or private organization that is responsible for payment for health care expenses. Payers may be insurance companies or self-insured employers.

stentry.p: "Contains the address of the insurance company." - HL7 Version 2.8, IN1-5.

A unique identifier that is used to identify the payer. For example Medicare assigns an identifier to a payer, Blue Cross/Blue Shield assigns an identifier to a payer. ASC X12 270/271 p 343, 358 example
"Contains unique identifiers for the insurance company." - HL7 Version 2.8, IN1-3.
"Carrier code assigned in Worker’s Compensation Program." - NCPDP Telecommunication (Field 327-CR, Data Dictionary 201104).
"Contains the name of the insurance company." - HL7 Version 2.8, IN1-4.
"Contains the phone number of the insurance company." - HL7 Version 2.8, IN1-7.
"Contains the name of the person who should be contacted at the insurance company." - HL7 Version 2.8, IN1-6.
Pointer to an organization that serves as an intermediary between the Biller and the Payer, and performs various value-added services, including routing of electronic payments.
Pointer to the Health Plan(s) that the owning Payer offers.
